page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: {FARMING} The major activity is dairy farming which includes intensive grazing and cattle breeding. Associated crops include mangols, fodder beet, silage and hay. Market crops are potatoes, broccoli, turnips, corn and one greenhouse centre produces tomatoes, runner beans, french beans, peppers, courgettes and various horticultural products. These products are transported to markets as far afield as Bristol. Apart from one large holding of over 1000 acres most farms are under 150 acres. The largest farm which totals 1900 acres, 700 of which is woodland also rears over 2000 sheep. In the season New Zealanders are brought over to shear these sheep. A major problem is that of unrealistic milk quotas and unreliable weather.
